span.breadcrumb_last,.tourbrd span,.tour-overview p, .tour-collection p,ul.highlight-this-tour li,.TourDates p,.pkg-inc ul li, .pkg-exc ul li,.tour-overview p b,h2.tourDBox,.sidebar_section_col ul li a {
    font-family: 'Roboto';
}

.TourDates p {
    font-size: 16px;
}

ul.highlight-this-tour li:before {
    content: "\f191";
    font: normal 14px/1 FontAwesome;
    color: #444;
    display: inline-block !important;
    width: 1em;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0 5px 0 0;
    text-align: center;
    font-variant: normal;
    text-transform: none;
    line-height: 1em;
    position: relative;
}
h2.tourDBox {
    font-weight: bold;
}
.TourList {
    border-left: dashed 1px #d8d8d8;
    border-radius: 0px;
    float: left;
    width: 100%;
    position: relative;
}
.TourDates:first-child {
    margin-top: 0;
    padding-top: 0;
}
.TourDates {
    margin: 15px 0 15px 0px;
    padding-top: 10px;
    margin-left: 20px;
    border-bottom: 1px solid #d8d8d8;
    font-size: 16px;
    cursor: pointer;
    display: block;
    color: #1F2225;
    float: left;
    width: 98%;
}
.TourDay_details {
    float: left;
    width: 85%;
    letter-spacing: 0.5px;
    word-spacing: 0.8px;
    line-height: normal;
    font-size: 14px;
}
.TourDay {
    color: #c00100;
    margin-right: 10px;
    float: left;
}
.expBut {
    width: 26px;
    text-align: center;
    color: #061b30;
    height: 28px;
    line-height: 23px;
    float: right;
    margin-left: 5px;
    margin-bottom: 6px;
    cursor: pointer;
    text-align: center;
    font-weight: bold;
    float: right;
    font-size: 22px;
    padding: 0 4px;
    border-radius: 21px;
}
.TourList .TourInfo {
    margin-left: 0;
    padding: 0 0px 20px 20px;
    background-color: white;
    overflow: hidden;
}
.tour-overview p, .tour-collection p {
    text-align: justify;
}
.TourList::after {
    content: '';
    position: absolute;
    width: 18px;
    height: 18px;
    left: -11px;
    background-color: white;
    border: 2px solid #061b30;
    top: 0px;
    border-radius: 50%;
    z-index: 1;
}
.tour-collection {
    float: left;
    width: 100%;
}

.sidebar_section_col, .sidebar_section_col2 {
    margin: 0 0 15px 0;
    background: #fff;
	-webkit-box-shadow: 0 1px 5px 0 rgb(0 0 0 / 30%);
    box-shadow: 0 1px 5px 0 rgb(0 0 0 / 30%);
    margin-top: 20px;
}
.sidebar_section_col h3, .sidebar_section_col2 h3, .sidebar_section_col div {
    font-size: 20px;
    color: #fff;
    background: #061b30;
    margin: 0;
    padding: 10px;
    font-family: 'Roboto';
    font-weight: bold;
}
.sidebar_section_col ul li a {
    color: #000;
    padding: 6px 10px;
    display: block;
    text-decoration: none;
    font-size: 16px;
}
.sidebar_section_col ul li i {
    padding-right: 5px;

    font-weight: bold;
}
.sidebar_section_col ul li.morepkg {
    background: #f1f3f2;
}
.sidebar_section_col ul li.morepkg a {
    color: #c00100;
    text-align: right;
    font-weight: bold;
}

.sidebar_section_col ul li:before {
    display: none;
}
.sidebar_section_col ul li {
    margin: 0;
    padding: 0px;
    list-style: none;
    border-bottom: 1px dotted #d8d7d4;
}

.TourDates p {
    font-weight: bold;
}

.tourbrd a {
    color: #bf000c;
    font-weight: bold;
}
.tour-collection .table-responsive {
    min-height: .01%;
    overflow-x: auto;
}
.tour-collection table {
    width: 100%;
    background: #9e9e9e54;
}
.tour-collection .table-newbg table tr {
    background-color: #fef2b8;
    border: none !important;
}
.tour-collection .table-newbg table th {
    font-size: 14px;
    color: #fff !important;
    text-align: center !important;
    padding-top: 6px !important;
    padding-bottom: 6px !important;
    background-color: #061b30;
    border: none !important;
}
.tour-collection .table-newbg table td {
    padding-top: 5px !important;
    padding-bottom: 5px !important;
    text-align: center !important;
    font-size: 14px;
    border: none !important;
	font-family: 'Roboto';
	font-weight: bold;
}

.pkg-inc ul li,.pkg-exc ul li {
    padding: 7px 0px 7px 22px !important;
    list-style: none;
    background: url(/wp-content/uploads/2022/01/inc.jpg) no-repeat left;
}

.pkg-inc ul li:before,.pkg-exc ul li:before {
    display: none;
}
.pkg-exc ul li {

}

<div class="custom_html">
<div class="tourbrd">
<h1>Rajasthan Honeymoon Tour Package</h1>
<p><span><a href="/" title="Home">Home</a> » <a href="/india-tour-packages" title="India Tour Packages">India</a> » <a href="/rajasthan-tour-packages" title="Rajasthan Tour Packages">Rajasthan</a> » <span class="breadcrumb_last" aria-current="page">Rajasthan Honeymoon Tour Package</span></span></p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div id="cmsmasters_row_673c2eed2c7c81_54105023" class="cmsmasters_row cmsmasters_color_scheme_default tourflexBox cmsmasters_row_top_default cmsmasters_row_bot_default cmsmasters_row_boxed">
<div id="tourflexBox2" class="cmsmasters_row_outer_parent">
<div class="cmsmasters_row_outer">
<div class="cmsmasters_row_inner">
<div class="cmsmasters_row_margin">
<div class="cmsmasters_column two_third">
<div class="custom_html tourIB1">
<div class="proGall"><img decoding="async" src="/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/romance-in-rajasthan.jpg" alt="Rajasthan Honeymoon Tour Package" title="Rajasthan Honeymoon Tour Package" width="750" height="450" loading="lazy"></div>
</div>
<div class="custom_html tourIB2">
<div class="tour-overview">
<div class="toBt"><i class="fa fa-file"></i> Tour Overview</div>
<p>Apart from being known as the land of palaces and maharajas, Rajasthan is also one of the prime romantic destinations. With the atmosphere enveloped in colorful beauty and surreal landscapes, Rajasthan can be your next favorite exotic destination for you and your better half. Explore the many vibrant faces of Rajasthan with Namaste India Trip’s, 6 days and 5 nights romantic tour of Rajasthan.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="custom_html tourIB4">
<div class="tour-collection">
<h2 class="tourDBox"><i class="fa fa-bus" aria-hidden="true"></i> Rajasthan Honeymoon Tour Itinerary Package</h2>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details" id="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 1 :</span>Arrival in Jaipur</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="">
<p>You will be transferred to your allotted hotel upon your arrival in Jaipur. Later you will be taken on a brief sightseeing tour of the city like – Hawa Mahal (palace of winds) – one of the most prominent landmarks of the city, representing the fine craftsmanship of the city; you will also be taken to Jantar Mantar – which is one of the most well preserved observatories in the subcontinent.</p>
<p>You will finally be taken back to your hotel for an overnight stay.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 2 :</span>Jaipur Sightseeing</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display: none;">
<p>Post breakfast, you will be taken on a brief excursion of Amber Fort palace – which is a classic sign of romance, and perched atop a large platform from where you can take a breathtaking view of the Jaipur city; Nahargarh fort will be your next destination which is located all along the Aravali ranges. Next stop for you will be the holy Laxmi Narayan temple – a Hindu temple dedicated to Goddess Laxmi and Lord Vishnu.</p>
<p>Later in the evening, you will be made to visit the teeming colorful marketplaces of Jaipur.</p>
<p>You can shop for locally made souvenirs like – traditional blue pottery, camel leather products, lac bangles, silk quilts, Jaipur handicrafts, bandhej and many more.</p>
<p>You also have the freedom to try out some delectable cuisines like – dal baati churma, laal maas, the iconic Rajasthani thali, Kachori and a whole plethora of others.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 3 :</span>Jaipur – Pushkar</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display: none;">
<p>You will be driven to Pushkar in the morning after breakfast, which is located at a distance of 2 hours and 40 mines. Upon arriving at Pushkar you will be immediately checked in to your hotel for staying the night. After freshening up you will be taken to Brahma Mandir – one of the few temples that is dedicated to Lord Brahma. It is a common belief that the Lord had personally chosen Pushkar as the temple site making it extremely pious. You will then proceed towards the sacred Pushkar Lake – which is surrounded by 52 bathing ghats and a dip here is believed to cleanse all your sins and skin related diseases.</p>
<p>After spending a memorable day in one of the most fascinating destinations in India, you will then be made to head back to your hotel.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 4 :</span>Pushkar – Udaipur</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display: none;">
<p>Early in the morning, you will be made to head for Udaipur, which is located at a distance of 5 hours and 10 mines. Upon arriving at this beautifully enchanting town you will be made to check in to your hotel for a night stay.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 5 :</span>Udaipur Sightseeing</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display: none;">
<p>Your sightseeing tour of Udaipur will commence in the morning starting with a visit to the famous city Palace museum – a beautifully created palace complex, which has served as the resident place for numerous ruling dynasties. Jagdish Mandir will be your next destination, which is situated just outside the royal city palace and is dedicated to Lord Jagannath and is one of the major tourist attractions in Udaipur. Saheliyon ki bari will be your next destination, a beautiful garden complete with numerous fountains, lotus pools and elephant statues made of marble. You will then be taken to bhartiya lok kala mandir which is a folk art museum.</p>
<p>After a day of exploration and fun you will be guided back to your hotel for staying the night.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 6 :</span>Udaipur (Departure to Delhi)</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display: none;">
<p>After the completion of your breakfast, you will be transferred to the airport or railway station from where you will depart towards Delhi and onto your desired location.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="custom_html tourIB8">
<div id="popularBox8" class="tour-collection">
<h3><i class="fa fa-question-circle" aria-hidden="true"></i> FAQs for Rajasthan Honeymoon Package</h3>
<div class="panel-body">
<div itemscope="">
<div class="click_ques" itemprop="name"><span>Q.</span> Is Rajasthan Suitable For A Honeymoon?</div>
<div class="ans_sec" style="overflow: hidden; display: none;">
<div itemprop="text">
<p><span>A.</span> However, if you are celebrating your honeymoon during the winter and want to experience some royalty as a couple, there is no better place to go than Rajasthan. Rajasthan, one of India's most romantic honeymoon destinations, has many charming places offering a variety of romantic things to do, attractions to visit, and places to stay.</p>
</p></div></div></div>
<div itemscope="">
<div class="click_ques" itemprop="name"><span>Q.</span> When Is The Best Time To Go On A Honeymoon In Rajasthan?</div>
<div class="ans_sec" style="overflow: hidden; display: none;">
<div itemprop="text">
<p><span>A.</span> Other than winter, the monsoon season is the best time to visit Rajasthan. The honeymoon months of July to September (Monsoon) are ideal, when the arid and barren landscape transforms into a lush green haven.</p>
</p></div></div></div>
<div itemscope="">
<div class="click_ques" itemprop="name"><span>Q.</span> What Is Rajasthan's Distinguishing Feature?</div>
<div class="ans_sec" style="overflow: hidden; display: none;">
<div itemprop="text">
<p><span>A.</span> The ruins of the Indus Valley civilisation at Kalibangan and Balathal, the Dilwara Temples, a Jain pilgrimage site at Rajasthan's only hill station, Mount Abu, in the ancient Aravalli mountain range and eastern Rajasthan, and the Keoladeo National Park of Bharatpur, a World Heritage Site, are among its major attractions.</p>
</p></div></div></div>
<div itemscope="">
<div class="click_ques" itemprop="name"><span>Q.</span> What Are Rajasthani Eating Habits?</div>
<div class="ans_sec" style="overflow: hidden; display: none;">
<div itemprop="text">
<p><span>A.</span> Rajasthani cuisine is influenced by the state's rich heritage and arid climate. Their cuisine is distinguished by the scarcity of fresh fruits and vegetables. Beans, lentils, gramme flour, corn, barley, millet, bajra, bread, and dairy products are all common ingredients (esp. Ghee).</p>
</p></div></div></div>
<div itemscope="">
<div class="click_ques" itemprop="name"><span>Q.</span> What Is The Name Of Rajasthani Clothing?</div>
<div class="ans_sec" style="overflow: hidden; display: none;">
<div itemprop="text">
<p><span>A.</span> Rajasthani women traditionally wear Ghagra, Choli (also known as Kanchli or Kurti), and Odhni. The Ghagra is a full-length, embroidered and pleated skirt available in a wide range of colours, prints, and fabrics such as silk, cotton, georgette, and crêpe.</p>
</p></div></div></div></div></div>
</div>
</div>

		</p>
		<div>
			<p><button type="submit" class="waves-bxt submitBtn2">SEND ME DETAILS <i class="fa fa-arrow-circle-right"></i></button><br />
<span class="infoBxs">We never share your Information.</span>
			</p>
		</div>
	</div>
</div><div class="wpcf7-response-output" aria-hidden="true"></div>

excerpt.rendered: Rajasthan Honeymoon Tour Package Home » India » Rajasthan » Rajasthan Honeymoon Tour Package Tour Overview Apart from being known as the land of palaces and maharajas, Rajasthan is also one of the prime romantic destinations. With the atmosphere enveloped in colorful beauty and surreal landscapes, Rajasthan can be your next favorite exotic destination for...
